title: Chromebook is not turning on
description:
i. Check the KB to follow the procedure.
 ii. Powerwash is the basic troubleshooting step for any Chromebook issue. Ask the parent or student first, as it will wipe the local data from the Chromebook. 
iii. Powerwash or Reset a Chromebook: https://tdsb.service-now.com/sp?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0000555 
iv. Chromebook Won't Turn On or Won't Charge: https://tdsb.service-now.com/sp?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0003398

title: Cannot log in to Chromebook
description:
i. Ask to use any other device to make sure the student is entering the correct credentials or to check if there is any issue with the account.
 ii. If everything is fine, ask to remove the account from the Chromebook and add it again.

title: Chromebook hardware issues
description: For hardware issues, they need to bring the device to school, and the teacher can log a ticket for that device to be checked by a technician. In the meantime, the student will get a temporary device depending on the school’s spare device availability.

title: Chromebook Charger
description:
i. The school will have to purchase a new charger for the student.
 ii. This can be done using the Technology Catalogue: https://tdsb.service-now.com/sp?id=technology_catalog&sys_id=b9e1adf1db13638cb040349f9d961930
 iii. You can also find this page by going to the ServiceIT home page > Selecting 'Service Catalogue' > Selecting 'Browse the Technology Catalogue' >  Selecting 'Accessories & Peripherals' on the left-hand side > Selecting 'Chargers & Power Adapters'

title: Chromebook new software request
description:
i. The teacher can put in a request for any software they want additionally for any particular student.
ii. The form is 'Windows/Mac Software Request'. 
iii. The form will be filled out by the teacher.

title: 1:1 Device Assignment
description:
i. The teacher has to fill out the form to assign or reassign a 1:1 device to a student. 
ii.Link: https://tdsb.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=80d52a2adb118a500acac689139619e9

title: Chromebook is lost, Stolen or Found
description:
i. The teacher has to fill out the form to report for a Chromebook. 
ii. The form is 'Report a Lost/Stolen/Found TDSB Device'.
iii. It will lock device so no one can use the device anymore. 
iv. Also when they found the device, same form needs to be filled out to unlock the device.

title: Chromebook or any other Security Investigation
description:
i. The Principal, VP or teachers has to fill out the form to request any cyber security investigation.
ii. The form is 'Cyber Security Investigation Requests'.

title: Chromebook Parental Control - Blocksi
description:
i. Parent have to contact your child’s school main office, and request Blocksi.
 ii. The Principal or Vice-Principal will need to make request on their behalf.
 iii. Read and forward this article to Parent for more info, Link: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KyBrU-STSMMgfzHLLGsn5w38VpddxxMbrMIyLvCOO90/edit#heading=h.hdpeo3kyokic

title: Chromebook hardware issue for Virtual Student
description: i. The student needs to contact Linda Edwards, 416-396-6818; provide the contact info of her to the students.
